member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.AudioStreamInfo
member.summary: Describes an elementary audio stream.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamInfo
member.summary:
Provides properties and operations that are common for all elementary streams.
and inherit from this class.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamInfo.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of this object.
member.returns: A new StreamInfo object that has the same dynamic type as the cloned object.
member.remarks:
When the object is cloned the full underlying object is copied.
For example if a StreamInfo object is actually an instance of and is cloned, the new object is also an instance of .

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamInfo.Reset
member.summary: Resets the stream information to its default state.
member.remarks: The full underlying object is reset. The media type of the stream is not changed.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamInfo.MediaType
member.summary: Media type. The media type of a StreamInfo object cannot be changed.

remarks.para: If the media type is MediaType.Audio this StreamInfo object can be safely cast to .
If the media type is MediaType.Video this StreamInfo object can be safely cast to .

member.summary: Various properties of the audio stream.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.AudioStreamInfo.Channels
member.summary: The number of audio channels in the stream.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.AudioStreamInfo.ChannelLayout
member.summary: The channel layout defines the mapping between channels and speakers.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.AudioStreamInfo.SampleRate
member.summary: The audio sample rate in Hz.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.AudioStreamInfo.BitsPerSample
member.summary: The number of valid bits per sample (sample resolution).

remarks.para: Common values are 8, 16, 20, 24 and 32.

Normally BitsPerSample sample is defined only for uncompressed audio streams. For compressed audio it is not defined and is 0. However it is possible for a compressed audio stream to return a positive value as an indication of audio quality. It can also designate the bits per sample of the LPCM stream once the compressed stream is decoded.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.AudioStreamInfo.BytesPerFrame
member.summary: The number of bytes occupied by an audio frame (smallest descrete unit).

remarks.para: A frame is the smallest descrete unit in an audio stream. It may contain one or more samples. Depending on the audio stream type the frame may contain fixed or variable number of samples.
For compressed streams the frame size is variable even if there are fixed number of samples in each frame. In this case BytesPerFrame is 0.

For an LCPM stream the frame size is constant. In this case BytesPerFrame is greater than 0.
Normally for interleaved LPCM streams the following is true:
BytesPerFrame / ChannelCount == SampleSize
The valid bits in a sample are given by and they are aligned towards the hi-order byte.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.LicenseStatusFlags.ValidationInProgress

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.LicenseStatusFlags.DemoBuild
member.summary:
= 2
This is a Demo build of AVBlocks. The library cannot be licensed and always operates in Demo mode.

member.summary: Defines specific errors.
member.remarks: The may also return errors like , and others.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.TranscoderError.NoChain
member.summary:
= 1
The transcoder could not build a processing chain based on its inputs and outputs. Either the transcoder inputs and outputs are not configured properly or they are not compatible with each other.
This error is returned by Transcoder.Open

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.TranscoderError.UndefinedSocketType
member.summary:
= 2
The stream type of a is not defined. When a media socket describes a file, the stream type is deduced from the file extension. When a media socket describes a stream the stream type must be set explicitly. See .
This error is returned by Transcoder.Open

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.TranscoderError.UnsupportedInterlacedConversion
member.summary:
= 3
It is not possible to convert from progressive to interlaced video.
Also it is not possible to switch interlace type from top-first to bottom-first or vice versa.
This error is returned by Transcoder.Open

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.TranscoderError.NoCodec
member.summary:
= 4
A required encoder or decoder is not available.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.TranscoderError.UnsupportedVideoConversion
member.summary:
= 5
It is not possible to convert from one uncompressed video format to another. See .

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.TranscoderError.BufferFull
member.summary:
= 6
One of the input/output buffers is full and cannot accept more data. Cannot accept more input through Transcoder.Push. Call Transcoder.Pull to obtain output samples.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.TranscoderError.InputNeeded
member.summary:
= 7
Cannot return output through Transcoder.Pull. Call Transcoder.Push to provide input samples.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType
member.summary: Defines audio and video stream subtypes.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType.Unknown
member.summary:
= 0
The stream subtype is not defined or is unknown.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType.AacAdts
member.summary:
= 1
Audio Data Transport Stream: AAC data in frames, similar to mp3. Somewhat compliant. Defined in Part 7 of the MPEG-2 standard (known formally as ISO/IEC 13818-7).

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType.AacAdif
member.summary:
= 2
Audio Data Interchange Format: AAC data with a single header. Worst compliance. Defined in Part 7 of the MPEG-2 standard (known formally as ISO/IEC 13818-7).

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType.AacMp4
member.summary:
= 3
AAC data packed in MPEG-4 container (MP4). Best compliance.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType.Avc1
member.summary:
= 4
H.264/AVC bitstream without start codes. This is how it is stored in a MPEG-4 container (MP4).
H.264 bitstreams that are transmitted over the air, or packed in MPEG-2 program or transport streams, or recorded on HD-DVD, are formatted as described in Annex B of ITU-T Rec. H.264. According to this specification, the bitstream consists of a sequence of network abstraction layer units (NALUs), each of which is prefixed with a start code equal to 0x000001 or 0x00000001.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType.MpegTsBdav
member.summary:
= 5
MPEG2 transport stream with valid packet time stamps.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType.MpegAudioLayer1
member.summary:
= 6
MPEG-1 Audio Layer I is commonly abbreviated to MP1. MPEG-1 Layer I is defined in ISO/IEC 11172-3.
MPEG-2 Layer I is defined in the MPEG-2 Part 3 standard (known formally as ISO/IEC 13818-3).

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType.MpegAudioLayer2
member.summary:
= 7
MPEG-1 Audio Layer II is commonly abbreviated to MP2. MP2 is a dominant standard for audio broadcasting. MPEG-1 Layer II is defined in ISO/IEC 11172-3.
MPEG-2 Layer II is defined in the MPEG-2 Part 3 standard (known formally as ISO/IEC 13818-3).

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType.MpegAudioLayer3
member.summary:
= 8
MPEG-1 Audio Layer III is commonly abbreviated to MP3. MPEG-1 Layer III is defined in ISO/IEC 11172-3.
MPEG-2 Layer III is defined in the MPEG-2 Part 3 standard (known formally as ISO/IEC 13818-3).

member.summary:
= 9
G.726 stream packed according to RFC 3551. This type of packetization is used in RTP.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType.G726PackedAAL2
member.summary:
= 10
G.726 stream packed according to ITU-T I.366.2 (AAL type 2). This type of packetization is used in Wave files.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType.Mpeg1System
member.summary:
= 11
MPEG-1 system (ISO/IEC 11172-1).

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.StreamSubType.Mpeg2System
member.summary:
= 12
MPEG-2 system (ISO/IEC 13818-1).

The vertical subsampling interval is 4. The horizontal subsampling interval is also 4 This means that a single V and a single U sample are taken for each square block of 16 image pixels. Effectively this averages 9 bits per pixel (16 pixels => 16Y + 1V + 1U => 144bits => 9bits/pixel)

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.PcmFlags
member.summary: Defines constants for various LPCM properties.
member.remarks: The constants are expressed as bit flags and can be combined together.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.PcmFlags.None
member.summary:
= 0
No flag is set.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.PcmFlags.Unsigned
member.summary:
= 0x1
The audio sample should be interpreted as an unsigned integral value.
member.remarks: The sample resolution (8-bit, 16-bit, etc.) is a separate LPCM property and is not expressed with . This flag is irrelevant when the Float flag is set.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.PcmFlags.Float
member.summary:
= 0x2
The audio sample should be interpreted as a floating point value.
member.remarks: The sample resolution (32-bit, 64-bit, etc.) is a separate LCPM property and is not expressed with .

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.PcmFlags.BigEndian
member.summary:
= 0x4
The sample value is stored in a big endian format. When this flag is not set the sample format is little endian.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.PcmFlags.NonInterleaved
member.summary:
= 0x8
When this flag is set audio samples from different channels are not interleaved. All samples from channel 0 are first in memory. They are followed by all samples from channel 1 and so on for all channels.
When this flag is not set the samples are interleaved. The first samples from all channels are first in memory. They are followed by the second samples from all channels and so on until the last sample in time.

member.summary:
= 1

member.remarks: For uncompressed audio/video with constant bitrate the quality is also constant. For compressed audio/video with constant bitrate the quality may be constant or variable.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.BitrateMode.VBR
member.summary:
= 2
Variable bitrate - quality oriented. Constant quality (more or less).

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.BitrateMode.ABR
member.summary:
= 3
Average bitrate.
member.remarks: Guarantees a predictable audio/video size similar to CBR. The bitrate changes to achieve the best quality within the available bitrate capacity.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.H264RateControlMethod
member.summary: Defines methods for bitrate contorl when encoding H.264/AVC

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.H264RateControlMethod.ABR
member.summary:
= 2
Average Bitrate.
member.remarks: Ensures that the output stream achieves a predictable long-term average bitrate.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.H264RateControlMethod.ConstantQuant
member.summary:
= 3
Constant Quantization.
member.remarks: Encodes the video to a constant quantizer. The encoder uses the specified target quantizer, not a target bitrate. The quantizer is a measure for the amount of data loss: a higher quantizer means that more data will be lost, which results in a better compression, but also delivers worse visual quality. This method could be used when a certain level of quality is required and the final bitrate is not a concern. The bitrate is unpredictable in this mode.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.PinConnection
member.summary: Defines pin connection disposition. These constants are used as special values of MediaPin.ID.
member.remarks: The transcoder tries to connect the input/output pins depending on the values of MediaPin.ID. A value greater than 0 specifies that the media pin participates in explicit mapping.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.PinConnection.Disabled
member.summary: The media pin does not participate in pin mapping and is never connected. The pin is ignored by the transcoder.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.PinConnection.Auto
member.summary: The media pin participates in an automatic (implicit) mapping. When 2 pins are automatically connected by the transcoder MediaPin.ID is updated with a value greater than 0.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param
member.summary: Defines parameters that can be passed to the transcoder and to the components that are used in the transcoding process.
member.remarks:
A parameter can be used with one or more components like decoders, encoders, demuxers, muxers, and others.
A parameter can apply to:
any component
a certain component category like encoders, decoders, demuxers, muxers, etc.
a component that handles a specific format like H.264 encoder, MPEG-2 encoder, MPEG-2 muxer, etc.
a specific implementation of a component, or a block like PrimoCodecs H.264 encoder
The value representation, range and interpretation is different for each parameter.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.ReEncode
member.summary: Specifies whether a stream will be reencoded.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The supported values are defined in enum. The default value is Use.Auto.
If this parameter is Use::Auto the reencoding is done only when the input and the output formats are not equivalent. If this parameter is Use::On the reencoding is done always even if the input and the output formats are equivalent. The case when this parameter is Use::Off is not implemented.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video
member.summary: Parameters specific to video processing filters

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.FrameRateConverter
member.summary: Parameters specific to video frame rate processing

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.FrameRateConverter.Use
member.summary: Video: Specifies whether a video frame rate filter is inserted in the processing chain. The filter converts the input frame rate to the output frame rate.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The supported values are defined in enum. The default value is Use.Auto.
If this parameter is Use::Auto the frame rate conversion is done only when the input frame rate differs form the output frame rate.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.FrameRateConverter.RealTime
member.summary: Video: Specifies whether a video frame rate filter is allowed to drop frames when a video encoder cannot keep up with the input in realtime.
member.remarks:
This parameter is a boolean value stored as one of the following: System.Boolean (true/false) or integral value (1/0). The default value is false.
If true the video frame rate filter is allowed to drop frames when a video encoder cannot keep up with the input in realtime.
If false the video frame rate filter does not drop frames when a video encoder cannot keep up with the input in realtime.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Deinterlacing
member.summary: Parameters specific to video deinterlacing

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Deinterlacing.Method
member.summary: Video: Specifies the deinterlacing method used by the deinterlacing filter.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The supported values are defined in the enum. The default value is DeinterlacingMethod.Blend

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Deinterlacing.Threshold
member.summary:
Video: Specifies the deinterlacing threshold that is used by some deinterlacing methods.
The threshold is used by the DeinterlacingMethod.MedianThreshold and DeinterlacingMethod.CAVT.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The supported values are in the range from 0 to 255. Zero specifies that a default threshold should be used. Each deinterlacing method may have its own default thresholde value.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Resize
member.summary: Parameters specific to video Resizing

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Resize.InterpolationMethod
member.summary: Video: Specifies the interpolation method that is used for resizing video frames.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The supported values are defined in the enum. The default value is InterpolationMethod.Cubic.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Crop
member.summary: Parameters specific to video croping

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Crop.Left
member.summary: Video: Specifies the area to be cropped inside the left edge of the input frame.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Crop.Right
member.summary: Video: Specifies the area to be cropped inside the right edge of the input frame.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Crop.Top
member.summary: Video: Specifies the area to be cropped inside the top edge of the input frame.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Crop.Bottom
member.summary: Video: Specifies the area to be cropped inside the bottom edge of the input frame.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Pad
member.summary: Parameters specific to video padding

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Pad.Left
member.summary: Video: Specifies the area to be padded inside the left edge of the output frame.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Pad.Right
member.summary: Video: Specifies the area to be padded inside the right edge of the output frame.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Pad.Top
member.summary: Video: Specifies the area to be padded inside the top edge of the output frame.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Pad.Bottom
member.summary: Video: Specifies the area to be padded inside the bottom edge of the output frame.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Video.Pad.Color
member.summary: Video: Specifies the padding color if any padding is set.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer. The color format is ARGB32: bits 0-7 is blue, bits 8-15 is green, bits 16-23 is red and bits 24-31 is the alpha channel.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Muxer
member.summary: Parameters specific to muxers.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Muxer.MP4
member.summary: Parameters specific to MP4 muxers.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Muxer.MP4.FastStart
member.summary:
Run a second pass moving the moov atom before the mdat atom.
Unless specified otherwise, the moov atom is normally stored at the end of the file. If the planned delivery method is progressive download or streaming, the moov atom will have to be moved to the beginning of the file.
member.remarks:
This parameter is a boolean value stored as one of the following: System.Boolean (true/false) or integral value (1/0). The default value is false.
If true a second pass will reorder the atoms in the file. The atoms will be in the order: moov, mdat.
If false the atoms in the file will be in the order: mdat, moov.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Muxer.MP4.FastStartUseTempFile
member.summary: Specifies whether a temp file should be used during the second pass.
member.remarks:
This parameter is a boolean value stored as one of the following: System.Boolean (true/false) or integral value (1/0). The default value is false.
If true a temp file will be used to reorder the atoms in the mp4 file.
If false the atoms reordering will be done inplace.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Muxer.MP4.FastStartTempFileDirectory
member.summary: Specifies the temp file directory. If this parameter is not set then the system temp path will be used.
member.remarks: This parameter type is string.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Decoder
member.summary: Parameters specific to decoders

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Decoder.Config
member.summary: Decoder configuration data.
member.remarks: This parameter is a object.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Decoder.Video
member.summary: Parameters specific to video decoders

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Decoder.Video.ConcealDefects
member.summary: Video: Specifies whether to conceal bitstream defects and errors.
member.remarks:
This parameter is a boolean value stored as one of the following: System.Boolean (true/false) or integral value (1/0). The default value is true.
If true non-fatal bitstream errors are concealed.
If false any bitstream error is reported.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Decoder.Video.H264
member.summary: Parameters specific to H.264 decoders

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Decoder.Video.H264.VUI
member.summary: Parameters the are part of the Video Usability Information in the H.264 stream. These parameters can aid decoding but a conformant decoder is not required to process them.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Decoder.Video.H264.VUI.MaxDecFrameBuffering
member.summary:
H264 Video: Specifies the requested size of the Decoded Picture Buffer.
This parameter can be used to achieve low latency decoding.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer (0-1).
A typical usage of this parameter is to set it to 1 or 0. In this case the number of decoding threads is implicitly limited to 1.
Zero latency is possible only with progressive streams with no B-frames. The decoder attempts to detect cases when this parameter can break decoding and may adjust it. However it's still possible that certain streams may not decode properly when this setting is too low.

member.summary: Parameters specific to encoders

member.summary: Parameters specific to audio encoders

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Audio.MPEG1.ForceV1
member.summary: MPEG Audio: Forces MPEG audio to version 1.
member.remarks: This parameter is a boolean value stored as one of the following: System.Boolean (true/false) or integral value (1/0). The default value is false.

member.summary: Parameters specific to Vorbis audio encoders

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Audio.Vorbis.Quality
member.summary: Vorbis Audio: Specifies the quality of the compressed audio.
member.remarks: This parameter is a floating point value. Supported values: from 0.0 (worst quality) to 1.0 (best quality). The default value is 0.4.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Audio.WMA
member.summary: Parameters specific to WMA audio encoders

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Audio.WMA.Quality
member.summary: Windows Media Audio: Specifies the quality of the compressed audio.

remarks.para: This parameter is an integer. Supported values: from 1 (worst quality) to 100 (best quality). The default value is 50.
This parameter is used by the Transcoder only when the encoded bitrate mode is BitrateMode.VBR, otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video
member.summary: Parameters specific to video encoders

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.MPEG2
member.summary: Parameters specific to MPEG-1 and MPEG-2 video encoders

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.MPEG2.GOPSize
member.summary: MPEG-1 and MPEG-2 Video: Size of the Group of Pictures (GOP, N).
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The integer value is the distance between two I-pictures (full images). The minimum value is 1 which means the stream will contain only I-pictures. The maximum value for MPEG-1 is 132.
The default value is 15.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.MPEG2.IPDistance
member.summary: MPEG-1 and MPEG-2 Video: Distance between successive reference pictures (GOP, M).
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The integer value is the distance between 2 successive reference pictures: I-I, I-P, P-I or P-P. The minimum value is 1 which means that the stream will contain I and P pictures but no B-pictures.
If IPDistance is equal to GOPSize and is greater than 1 then the stream will contain only I and B picutres, but no P-pictures.
The default value is 3.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.MPEG2.VBVBufferSize
member.summary: MPEG-1 and MPEG-2 Video: Size of the internal VBV buffer in units of 16384 bits.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The default value is 20 for MPEG-1 and 112 for MPEG-2.
A value of 0 means to use the encoder default setting.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264
member.summary: Parameters specific to H.264 encoders

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.Profile
member.summary: H.264 Video: Encoding profile.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The supported values are defined in enum. The default value is H264Profile.High.
Sets the value of the profile_idc syntax element.
Note: Make sure that the other encoding parameters are set in accordance with the profile setting. If there is an encoding parameter that is not supported at the specfied profile then the encoder will use a higher profile. For example: If the profile is set to Baseline and CABAC is enabled then the encoder will use Main profile. CABAC is not supported at Baseline profile.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.EntropyCodingMode
member.summary: H.264 Video: Entropy coding mode.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The supported values are defined in enum. The default value is H264EntropyCodingMode.CABAC.
CABAC compresses data more efficiently (10-20% typically) than CAVLC but requires considerably more processing to decode.
CABAC is supported at Main, High, High10, High422 and High444. CABAC is not supported at Baseline profile.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.NumBFrames
member.summary: H.264 Video: Number of B-frames between consequent I-frames or P-frames.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The integer value must be a number that is greater than or equal to zero.
The default value is 0.
B-frames are supported at Main, High, High10, High422 and High444. B frames are not supported at Baseline profile.
H.264 stream without B frames looks like: IPPPPPPP...PI... H.264 stream with B frames (NumBFrames 2) looks like: IBBPBBPBBP...PI
The main advantage of the usage of B frames is coding efficiency. In most cases, B frames will result in less bits being coded overall. B-frames can use both previous and forward frames for data reference to get the highest amount of data compression.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.TreatBFramesAsReference
member.summary: H.264 Video: Allows B-pictures to be used as reference pictures.
member.remarks: This parameter is a boolean value stored as one of the following: System.Boolean (true/false) or integral value (1/0). The default value is true.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.NumRefFrames
member.summary: H.264 Video: Maximum number of reference pictures. Sets the maximum number of references stored in the Decoded Picture Buffer (DPB) for motion estimation and compensation. Essentially sets the syntax element num_ref_frames in the sequence parameter sets.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer value.
The integer value must be consistent with profile/level parameters for a given frame size, since they determine reference picture and buffer constraints for a decoder.
If P-pictures are allowed, the number should be greater than 0.
If B-pictures are allowed, the number should be greater than 1. The default value is 1.
This setting controls how many frames can be referenced by P- and B-Frames. Higher values will usually result in a more efficient compression, but will also require more time for encoding.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.NumSlices
member.summary: H.264 Video: Number of slices per frame/field.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer value. A frame/field is divided into equal parts except for the last one that can be shorter. The number cannot exceed the number of macro blocks per frame/field. The default value is 0 (auto).

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.Level
member.summary: H.264 Video: Computation level. Set the value of the level_idc syntax element.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer value. A level designated as x.y is expressed as an xy integer. For example level 1 is expressed as 10, level 1.1 as 11 and so on. The level must be in accordance with the H.264 standard. It must correspond to the number of reference frames and frame size. A value of 0 specifies automatic level computation. The default value is 0 (auto).
Note: Similar with the Profile, Level specifies the capabilities a decoder must fulfill to decode a bitstream of a certain level. Most level restrictions are driven by memory restrictions and set restrictions such as resolution supported, maximum number of references, frame rate etc.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.DeblockingFilter
member.summary: H.264 Video: De-blocking filter mode.

remarks.p: The supported values are defined in enum. The default value is H264DeblockingFilter.All.
The in-loop deblocking filter helps prevent the blocking artifacts common to other DCT-based image compression techniques, resulting in better visual appearance and compression efficiency

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.DeblockingFilterAlpha
member.summary: H.264 Video: De-blocking filter strength.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer value. Supported values range from -6 to 6. Negative values give a more sharp video, but they also increases the danger of visible block artifacts. In contrast positive values result in a smoother video, but they will also remove more details. The default value is 0.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.DeblockingFilterBeta
member.summary: H.264 Video: De-blocking filter threshold.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer value.
The parameter controls the threshold for block detection.
Supported values range from -6 to 6.
Negative values "save" more details, but more blocks might slip through (especially in flat areas). In contrast positive values will remove more details and catch more blocks. The default value is 0 and usually it's enough to detect all blocks.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.Transform8x8
member.summary: H.264 Video: Enables 8x8 transform block size.
member.remarks:
This parameter is a boolean value expressed as an integer (1|0).
Supported modes are:
0 - Disabled. Only 4x4 transforms are used.
1 - Enabled. Allows the additional use of 8x8 transform.
The default is Enabled (1).
Transform 8x8 improves the visual quality at a minor speed cost.
Transform 8x8 is supported at High, High10, High422 and High444. 8x8 transform is not supported at Main and Baseline profiles.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.DirectPredMode
member.summary: H.264 Video: Direct prediction mode. Sets the value of the syntax element direct_spatial_mv_pred_flag.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The supported values are defined in enum. The default value is H264DirectPredMode.Temporal.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.QualitySpeed
member.summary: H.264 Video: Quality/Speed trade off.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer value. Supported values range from 0 to 4 where 0 means max speed and 4 means max quality. The default value is 0.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.MERangeSearchX
member.summary: H.264 Video: Specifies how far motion estimation should be done in a horizontal direction.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer value. The default value is 8.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.MERangeSearchY
member.summary: H.264 Video: Specifies how far motion estimation should be done in a vertical direction.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer value. The default value is 8.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.MESplitMode
member.summary: H.264 Video: Specifies the block size for which motion estimation should be done.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The supported values are defined in enum. The default value is MESplitMode.Only16x16.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.MEMethod
member.summary: H.264 Video: Motion estimation method.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The supported values are defined in enum. The default value is MEMethod.Log.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.PictureCodingType
member.summary: H.264 Video: Picture coding type.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The supported values are defined in enum. The default value is PictureCodingType.Frames.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.RateControlMethod
member.summary: H.264 Video: Rate control method.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
The supported values are defined in enum. The default value is RateControlMethod.ABR.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.RateControlQuantI
member.summary: H.264 Video: Rate control quantizer for I slices. Used only when RateControlMethod is set to Constant Quantization.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
Supported values range: from 0 to 51. The default value is 20.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.RateControlQuantP
member.summary: H.264 Video: Rate control quantizer for P slices. Used only when RateControlMethod is set to Constant Quantization.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
Supported values range: from 0 to 51. The default value is 20.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.RateControlQuantB
member.summary: H.264 Video: Rate control quantizer for B slices. Used only when RateControlMethod is set to Constant Quantization.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer.
Supported values range: from 0 to 51. The default value is 20.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.KeyFrameInterval
member.summary: H.264 Video: Distance between two sequential I-pictures.
member.remarks: This parameter is an integer value. Must be greater than or equal to 0. Both 0 and 1 mean that every picture is coded as I-picture. The default value is 250.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.KeyFrameIDRInterval
member.summary: H.264 Video: Distance between two sequential IDR-pictures in terms of I pictures. IDR stands for Instantaneous Decoding Refresh.
member.remarks:
This parameter is an integer value. It must be greater or equal to 0.
For example if this parameter is 10 then every tenth I-picture is also an IDR-picture.
An IDR picture is a special kind of I frame used in an H.264 stream. Pictures following an IDR-picture may not refer back to pictures preceding the IDR-picture. IDR-pictures can be used to create H.264 streams which are more easily edited. The default value is 1.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.AccessUnitDelimiters
member.summary: H.264 Video: Use access unit delimiters.
member.remarks: This parameter is a boolean value stored as one of the following: System.Boolean (true/false) or integral value (1/0). The default value is false.

member.name: F:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Param.Encoder.Video.H264.FixedFramerate
member.summary: H.264 Video: Write timing info with a fixed frame rate in the bitstream.
member.remarks:
This parameter is a boolean value expressed as an integer (1|0).
The default value is True (1).
The timing info is written in the bitstream only when this parameter is True and a positive frame rate is specified.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.MediaPin
member.summary: MediaPin represents an elementary media stream.
member.remarks:
MediaPin object can exist for audio, video or any other type of stream. However, AVBlocks can process only the audio and video streams.
MediaPin objects are used as inputs and outputs of .

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.MediaPin.Connection
member.summary: Connection ID. This should not be confused with the stream ID that is defined for certain stream types.
member.remarks:
A object matches and connects input and output pins by their connection ID. The processes the connected pins and ignores the unconnected pins.
Pins are connected to one another according to the following rules:
Input pins with connection ID greater than PinConnection.Auto are connected to output pins with the same connection ID. In this case the requires that a single unique connection ID is used by exactly one input and one output pin.
Input and output pins with connection ID equal to PinConnection.Auto are connected automatically based on their media type (audio or video).
Input and output pins with connection ID equal to PinConnection.Disabled are ignored.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.MediaPin.StreamInfo
member.summary: Information about the elementary stream represented by this pin.
member.remarks: The ignores pins that are not audio or video elementary streams. If the value of StreamInfo.MediaType is MediaType.Audio, it is safe to cast this property to . If the media type is MediaType.Video, it is safe to cast this property to .

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.MediaPin.Params
member.summary: A collection of pin parameters. These parameters affect the processing of the elementary stream represented by this pin. The default value of this property is an empty list. A System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary instance can be used to set the parameters.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.MediaSocket
member.summary: An input or output point of the .
member.remarks:
A MediaSocket object describes either a container (WAV, AVI, MP4, etc.) with one or more streams or simply an elementary stream (MP3, M2V, etc.)
When MediaSocket describes a container the child collection of media pins can contain one or more items (for each contained stream). The socket stream type designates the container type.
When MediaSocket describes an elementary stream the child collection of media pins contains a single item which is the elementary stream itself. The socket stream type is the same as the pin stream type.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.MediaSocket.FromMediaInfo(PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.MediaInfo)
member.summary: Creates a media socket from a object.
member.param: A object with loaded audio/video information. This object is not needed once this method returns.
member.returns: A new MediaSocket object which contains the information supplied by the parameter.
member.remarks:
This method is meant to help in setting correctly the inputs of the .
The intended usage is as follows:
Use to load information for a file or user stream.
Create a media socket from the object (MediaSocket.FromMediaInfo(mediaInfo)).
Add the newly created socket to the inputs of the (Transcoder.Inputs.Add(socket)).

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.MediaSocket.FromPreset(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a media socket from an AVBlocks .
member.param: A constant from the enum.
member.returns: A new MediaSocket object which is configured for the specified .
member.remarks:
This method is meant to help in setting correctly the outputs of the .
. The intended usage is as follows:
Create a media socket from a (MediaSocket.FromPreset(preset)).
Add the newly created socket to the outputs of the (Transcoder.Outputs.Add(socket)).

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder
member.summary: Provides functionality for audio and video encoding, decoding and transforming.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder.#ctor
member.summary:
Creates a Transcoder object in its default state.
When the Transcoder object is not needed anymore it should be disposed in order to deterministically reclaim the allocated resources.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder.Open
member.summary: Initializes the Transcoder based on the specified input and desired output.
member.returns: true if the Transcoder is sucessfully initialized and is ready to process data; otherwise false.
member.remarks:
If this method succeeds the Transcoder is ready to process input data.
The data flow may be driven by one of the following methods:
Push() - The caller pushes input data to the Transcoder. The Transcoder writes the output data to a file or user stream.
Pull() - The caller pulls output data from the Transcoder. The Transcoder reads the input data from a file or user stream.
Push() and Pull() - The caller both pushes and pulls data to/from the Transcoder.
Run() - The caller waits for the transcoding to finish. The Transcoder automatically reads the input data from a file or user stream and writes the output to a file or user stream. The process runs until the input data is depleted or there's a processing error.
However not all stream types can be used in push or pull mode. See related page "Transcoder Input/Output Model" for more info.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder.Run
member.summary: Runs an automatic transcoding.

returns.para: true when the transcoding has succeeded.
false when there's a transcoding error or the Run() method cannot be used with the specified inputs and outputs.

remarks.para: In order to use the run mode all input and output sockets must be associated with files or user streams. This method returns when the transcoding is finished because there's no more input data to process or when there's an error.

NOTE: The input socket can specify an image file in which case the output video contains a single frame. A single frame video (MPEG-2) can be used as a background in DVD-Video authoring. For generating a custom video from many images see Push().

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder.Push(System.Int32,PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.MediaSample)
member.summary: Pushes input data to the Transcoder.
member.param: Specifies the index of the input socket whose data is pushed to the Transcoder.
A object that contains the input data in the property. When this method returns successfully contains no valid data.
member.returns: true when the Transcoder has successfully processed the input data, otherwise false.

remarks.para: In order to use this method the input socket must not have an associated file or user stream. If the Transcoder operates in the hybrid push/pull mode it will return TranscoderError.BufferFull when it cannot accept the input. In this case Pull() must be called to retrieve the available output.

NOTE: The input sample can contain an image like bmp, png or jpeg. This makes it possible to create a video from one or more images with any duration. The start time of each input sample must be set explicitly and must increase for each successive sample.

member.remarks: Warning: This method is not thread-safe (as all other functions in AVBlocks). It cannot be called simultaneously from multiple threads. You must implement your own synchronization if the method will be called from multiple threads.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder.PushUnmanaged(System.Int32,PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.MediaSample)
member.summary: Pushes input data to the Transcoder.
member.param: Specifies the index of the input socket whose data is pushed to the Transcoder.
A object that contains the input data in the property. When this method returns successfully contains no valid data.
member.returns: true when the Transcoder has successfully processed the input data, otherwise false.

remarks.para: In order to use this method the input socket must not have an associated file or user stream. If the Transcoder operates in the hybrid push/pull mode it will return TranscoderError.BufferFull when it cannot accept the input. In this case Pull() must be called to retrieve the available output.

NOTE: The input sample can contain an image like bmp, png or jpeg. This makes it possible to create a video from one or more images with any duration. The start time of each input sample must be set explicitly and must increase for each successive sample.

member.remarks: Warning: This method is not thread-safe (as all other functions in AVBlocks). It cannot be called simultaneously from multiple threads. You must implement your own synchronization if the method will be called from multiple threads.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder.Pull(System.Int32@,PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.MediaSample)
member.summary: Pulls output data from the Transcoder.
member.param: Returns the index of the output socket to which the data belongs.
The MediaSample object receives the output data in the property.
member.returns: true if the Transcoder has successfully generated output, otherwise false.
member.remarks: In order to use the pull mode the output sockets must not have an associated file or user stream. If the transcoder operates in the hybrid push/pull mode it will return TranscoderError.InputNeeded when there's no available output. In this case Push() must be called to supply input data to the transcoder.

Warning: This method is not thread-safe (as all other functions in AVBlocks). It cannot be called simultaneously from multiple threads. You must implement your own synchronization if the method will be called from multiple threads.

member.remarks: In order to use the pull mode the output sockets must not have an associated file or user stream. If the transcoder operates in the hybrid push/pull mode it will return TranscoderError.InputNeeded when there's no available output. In this case Push() must be called to supply input data to the transcoder.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder.AutoConnect
member.summary: Specifies whether the Transcoder automatically connects input to output pins when opened.
member.remarks: Only pins that have their ID property equal to PinConnection.Auto participate in the automatic connection. Those pins that are sucessfully connected have their ID property set to a unique value that is greater than PinConnection.Auto.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder.AllowDemoMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the Transcoder allows demo mode (unlicensed transcoding).
member.remarks: If true a demo watermark is applied when a required feature (codec/format) is not licensed. If false the Transcoder returns an AVBlocksError.UnlicensedFeature error instead of applying the demo watermark when a required feature is not licensed.

member.name: E:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder.OnProgress
member.summary: This event is raised periodically by the Transcoder to report transcoding progress. See Transcoder.Run.

remarks.para: For performance reasons this event is not raised for every processed media sample. Currently it is called once for every 0.5 seconds of processed media data. This notification is intended for user interface updates.

The transcoding progress in percents is given by the properties of :
(CurrentTime / TotalTime * 100).
The Transcoder does not guarantee that CurrentTime will ever reach TotalTime even when the transcoding completes sucessfully.

member.name: E:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder.OnStatus
member.summary: This event is raised by the Transcoder to report the status of current operation.

member.name: E:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder.OnContinue
member.summary: This event is raised by the Transcoder to give the user code a chance to stop the transcoding process started by Transcoder.Run.

remarks.para: When instructed the Transcoder stops the transcoding process gracefully so that the media data processed so far is valid (playable).

This event is called as often as possible so that the user code may stop the transcoding process as soon as it is required. For this reason there should be minimal processing in this event, otherwise the overall transcoding may be slowed down.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.Transcoder.Error

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer
member.summary: Unmanaged buffer for media data.
member.remarks: MediaBuffer has a capacity which is the size of the buffer and data size which is the size of the actual data in the buffer. The buffer is a continuous block of memory. The valid data is also a continuous block. The data can start at any offset in the buffer.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a MediaBuffer and optionally allocates a buffer storage
member.param: Specifies the requested buffer size. If 0 the buffer is created without storage. Buffer storage can be attached (), explicitly allocated ( or automatically allocated when data is appended to the buffer ().

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.Alloc(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allocates internal buffer storage
member.param: Requested buffer size. A buffer storage is allocated only if the requested exceeds the current buffer size (capacity). The actual allocated buffer may be larger than the requested .
Specifies whether to keep the existing data when the existing buffer is resized.
member.returns: The allocation request succeeded. FALSE The allocation failed (out of memory).
member.remarks: If an external storaged is attached it is automatically detached.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.Free
member.summary: Frees internal buffer storage
member.remarks: The function does nothing if an external storage is attached to the buffer.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.Attach(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attaches an external buffer storage
member.param: A pointer to the buffer storage.
The buffer storage size.
Specifies whether to autoset data with a size equal to the buffer size. If true the DataSize is equal to Capacity. If false DataSize is 0.
member.returns: If true the buffer is attached succefully, false otherwise.
member.remarks: If an internal storaged is already allocated it is automatically freed.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.Detach
member.summary: Detaches an external buffer storage
member.returns: A pointer to the detached buffer storage. null if no external storage has been attached.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.Clear
member.summary: Clears existing data.
member.remarks: The operation does not change the buffer capacity.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.Normalize
member.summary: Moves the existing data to the start of the buffer amd maximizes the free linear space.
member.remarks: This may be useful when new data is added through direct copying after the existing data and then setData is used to extend/modify the data range. The operation does not change the buffer capacity.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.Append(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Appends data to the end of the MediaBuffer data.
member.param: A pointer to the data that should be appended.
The number of bytes that should be appended.
member.returns: true The operation is successful, false otherwise.
member.remarks: If MediaBuffer has internal storage it will be increased if needed to fit the . If MediaBuffer has external storage and the provided data cannot fit the operation will fail.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.Remove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes data from the beginning of the MediaBuffer data.
member.param: The number of bytes that should be removed from the valid data.
member.returns: true The operation is successful, false otherwise.
member.remarks: The operation does not change the buffer capacity.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.SetData(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the offset at which valid data starts in the buffer and the data size in bytes. The data offset and size are validated so that they are always within the buffer.
member.param: The offset at which valid data starts in the buffer. Allowed values range from 0 to Capacity-1.
The size of the valid data in the buffer. Allowed values range from 0 to Capacity.

returns.para: true The data offset and size are successfully changed.
false The supplied data offset and size are not valid.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the UnmanagedMediaBuffer and reclaims the resources used by the object.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.Release
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged buffer. Equivalent to Dispose().

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.Finalize
member.summary: The finalizer is a safe guard if the Dispose() method is not called. However it is strongly recommended that the UnmanagedMediaBuffer is disposed when it is not needed rather than relying on the GC to call the finalizer.

member.returns: true if an external buffer storage is attached, false otherwise.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.BufPtr
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the start of the buffer. It is guaranteed that the pointer is valid only when Capacity is greater than 0.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.DataPtr
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the first byte of data. This is effectively the same as BufPtr + DataOffset.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.DataOffset
member.summary: The offset at which valid data starts in the buffer. Ranges from 0 to Capacity-1.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.DataSize
member.summary: The size of the valid data in the buffer. Ranges from 0 to Capacity.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.Capacity
member.summary: Returns the size of the buffer in bytes. Can be zero.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.FreeLinearSpace
member.summary: Returns the free linear space that can be used to append data without normalization.
member.remarks: The free linear space starts at DataOffset + DataSize. Its size is equal to Capacity - DataSize - DataOffset. It is less than or equal to FreeSpace.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.UnmanagedMediaBuffer.FreeSpace
member.summary: Returns the free space that can be used to append data without buffer reallocation.
member.remarks: The free space starts at DataOffset + DataSize. Its size is Capacity - DataSize. It is greater than or equal to FreeLinearSpace.

member.name: T:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.VideoStreamInfo
member.summary: Describes an elementary video stream.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.VideoStreamInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a default VideoStreamInfo object.

member.name: M:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.VideoStreamInfo.Reset
member.summary: Resets the video stream information to its default state.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.VideoStreamInfo.FrameWidth
member.summary: The video frame width.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.VideoStreamInfo.FrameHeight
member.summary: The video frame height.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.VideoStreamInfo.DisplayRatioHeight
member.summary: The vertical dimension of the display aspect ratio.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.VideoStreamInfo.DisplayRatioWidth
member.summary: The horizontal dimension of the display aspect ratio.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.VideoStreamInfo.FrameRate
member.summary: The video frame rate.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.VideoStreamInfo.ColorFormat
member.summary: The video color format.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.VideoStreamInfo.ScanType
member.summary: The interlace (scan) type of the video frame.

member.name: P:PrimoSoftware.AVBlocks.VideoStreamInfo.FrameBottomUp
member.summary: Specifies whether the video frame is stored upside down internally.
member.remarks:
When true the frame is stored upside down (vertically flipped) but logically it should be displayed normally. This is typical for bitmaps.
When false the frame is displayed as it is stored - top row is first in memory, bottom row is last.
